Understate: The claim may be understating the potential benefits of the Foxconn deal by focusing solely on the cost to taxpayers without considering potential economic growth and job creation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that each job cost taxpayers more than $1 million.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the full $3 billion in incentives will be paid out, even though it is contingent on Foxconn meeting certain requirements.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the cost of the incentives, such as potential long-term economic benefits or the need to compete with other states for the Foxconn deal.
